[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/suilend_d/suilend/sources/oracles.move] [Function: get_pyth_price_and_identifier()] [No Return Value Documentation] The function returns (Option<Decimal>, Decimal, PriceIdentifier) but doesn't document when spot is None vs Some. Can caller misuse this? (Medium)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/suilend_d/suilend/sources/oracles.move] [Function: parse_price_to_decimal()] [No Error Handling] parse_price_to_decimal doesn't return Option or Result, so errors panic. Can this be exploited to DOS if invalid Price objects are passed? (High)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/suilend_d/suilend/sources/oracles.move] [Function: get_pyth_price_and_identifier()] [Reference Semantics] The function takes &PriceInfoObject and &Clock by reference. Can caller provide malicious shared objects that change mid-execution? (Low)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/suilend_d/suilend/sources/oracles.move] [Module Dependencies] The module imports pyth::*, suilend::decimal. If these dependencies are upgraded with breaking changes, can oracle module break? (Low)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/suilend_d/suilend/sources/oracles.move] [Function: parse_price_to_decimal()] [i64 Type Usage] The function uses pyth::i64 type. If this has bugs in magnitude/sign operations, can parse_price_to_decimal produce wrong results? (Medium)
